The King Mosque ( or Xhamia e Hynqarit), also known as the '''Sultan's Mosque () or Sultan Bayezid Mosque''', is a mosque located in Berat City, Berat County, Albania. Completed in 1492 CE, the mosque was designated as a Cultural Monument of Albania in 1948.
Overview
The mosque was built in the 15th century by the Ottoman sultan Bayezid II for the local Albanian population.
Gallery
Ceiling of King Mosque in Berat.jpg|Ceiling of the mosque
Pjesa balllore e xhamisë Mbret në Berat.jpg|Southern part of the mosque
